bwwExcerpt: How far would you go for family? That's the deceptively complex question posed by 'The Winslow Boy,' a satisfying, very British drama from the Roundabout Theatre Co. now open at the American Airlines Theatre. In the case of the Winslows, an upper-class clan living in London's Kensington district, the answer is: you go until it hurts, and then you go some more...It's a credit to actor Rees that the dated storyline and Masterpiece-esque class distinctions don't come off as exceptionally antiquated...
